items.prompt: How do you say 500 in English?

items.explanation: Usamos la preposición 'at' para horas específicas.

items.prompt: Which day is part of the weekend?
items.explanation: El fin de semana (weekend) está compuesto por el sábado y el domingo.
Para los 15 minutos después de la hora, usamos 'quarter past'.

items.prompt: How do you say 1,000 in English?

items.explanation: The order is Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday...

items.prompt: How do you say the number 0 in a phone number?
items.explanation: In phone numbers, 0 can be said as 'Zero', 'Oh', or 'Nought'.

items.prompt: What is the correct way to say 2:30?
items.explanation: Both 'Two thirty' and 'Half past two' are correct.

items.prompt: Complete: 'I have a project deadline ______ Friday.'
items.explanation: We use 'on' for days of the week.

items.prompt: How do you say 15:45 in office time?
items.explanation: Both 'Three forty-five' and 'Quarter to four' are common.

items.title: The Office Schedule
items.text: The office opens at 8:00 AM on Monday. There are 25 employees. We have a coffee break at 10:30 AM for fifteen minutes. Lunch is at 1:00 PM.

questions.question: What time does the office open?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'The office opens at 8:00 AM'.

items.title: Monthly Meeting
items.text: The manager has a meeting every first Wednesday of the month. Today is Wednesday, October 5th. The meeting is at 2:00 PM in Room 302.

questions.question: What day of the week is the meeting?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'The manager has a meeting every first Wednesday'.

questions.question: Which room is the meeting in?

items.title: Delivery Times
items.text: The delivery arrives at 11:45 AM. There are 12 boxes. Each box has 100 pens. The total number of pens is 1,200.

questions.question: What time does the delivery arrive?
How many pens are in each box?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'Each box has 100 pens'.

items.title: New Employee ID
items.text: Mark is a new employee. His ID number is 0742. He works from Monday to Thursday. He finishes work at 6:00 PM.

questions.question: What is Mark's ID number?
questions.explanation: The ID is 0742 (Zero seven four two).

questions.question: Does Mark work on Friday?
questions.explanation: The text says he works 'from Monday to Thursday'.

items.title: Price List
items.text: The price of a notebook is $5. A pack of pencils is $3. If you buy 10 notebooks, the price is $50. The shipping cost is $12.

questions.question: How much is one notebook?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'The price of a notebook is $5'.

questions.question: How much is the shipping?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'The shipping cost is $12'.

items.title: Office Contact
items.text: Our office phone number is 020 7946 0123. We are open from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM. For urgent calls, dial extension 400.

questions.question: What time does the office close?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'open from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM'.

items.title: Training Session
items.text: There is a training session on Tuesday morning. It starts at 9:15 AM and ends at 11:45 AM. There are 18 people in the session.

questions.question: What day is the training?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'training session on Tuesday morning'.

questions.question: How many people are in the session?

items.title: Invoice Details
items.text: Invoice #882 is for $450. The date is August 12th. Please pay within 30 days. Contact us at ext. 05.

items.title: Flight Schedule
items.text: The manager's flight is at 7:20 PM. He needs to be at the airport 2 hours before. He leaves the office at 4:30 PM.

questions.question: What time is the flight?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'flight is at 7:20 PM'.

questions.question: What time does he leave the office?
questions.explanation: The text says: 'He leaves the office at 4:30 PM'.

items.title: Weekly Report
items.text: The weekly report is due on Friday by 4:00 PM. It has 8 pages. Please send 3 copies to the director.

questions.question: How many copies do you need?

items.prompt: How do you write 'Three hundred and forty' in numbers?
Which month is the 5th month of the year?
How do you say '12:00' during the day?

items.explanation: Both are correct ways to say the time.
We use 'on' for days of the week.

items.prompt: Write the missing number: Ten, Twenty, ________, Forty.

items.title: Phone Number Check
items.transcript:
A: What is your phone number? 
B: It is zero, seven, five, three, four, one.

items.title: Setting a Time
items.transcript:
A: Let's meet at half past three. 
B: Okay, three thirty is fine for me.

questions.question: Does speaker B agree?
questions.explanation: B says 'three thirty is fine for me'.

items.title: Counting Items
items.transcript:
A: How many laptops do we have? 
B: We have twelve new laptops and five old ones.

questions.question: How many new laptops are there?
questions.explanation: B says 'We have twelve new laptops'.

questions.question: What is the total number of laptops?

items.title: The Date
items.transcript:
A: When is the interview? 
B: It is on Friday, June 14th.

items.title: Office Address
items.transcript:
A: Where is the office? 
B: It is at one hundred and twenty-eight Oxford Street.

items.title: Budget Figures
items.transcript:
A: What is the total budget for the event? 
B: It is nine hundred and fifty pounds.

items.title: Work Hours
items.transcript:
A: What time do you finish work on Friday? 
B: I finish early, at four o'clock.

questions.question: What day are they talking about?

items.title: Ticket Price
items.transcript:
A: How much are the train tickets? 
B: They are twenty-two dollars each.

questions.question: Are they talking about buses or trains?

items.title: Room Reservation
items.transcript:
A: I need to book Room fifteen for tomorrow. 
B: Room fifteen is busy from nine to eleven AM.

questions.question: What time is the room busy?
questions.explanation: B says 'from nine to eleven AM'.

items.title: Employee Count
items.transcript:
A: How many people work in the marketing team? 
B: There are eighteen people in marketing.

items.prompt: Complete: 'There are ______ days in a week.'
How do you say 0.5 in a decimal?
items.explanation: All are acceptable ways to say 0.5.
November is the 11th month, December is the 12th.

items.prompt: How many minutes are in one hour?

items.title: Staff Numbers
items.text: The company has 5 departments. Each department has 10 staff members. The total number of staff is 50. Most staff work from 9:00 to 5:00.

questions.question: What is the total number of staff?
questions.explanation: The text says 'total number of staff is 50'.

items.title: Reception Hours
items.text: The reception is open on Monday and Tuesday from 8:30 AM to 6:00 PM. On Wednesday it closes early at 1:00 PM.

questions.question: What time does reception open on Monday?
What happens on Wednesday?
questions.explanation: The text says 'closes early at 1:00 PM'.

items.title: Stock Check
items.text: We have 200 monitors in stock. 15 monitors are broken. We need to order 50 more next month, which is November.

questions.question: How many monitors are broken?
questions.explanation: The text says '15 monitors are broken'.

questions.question: What month is it likely now?
questions.explanation: If next month is November, now is October.

items.title: Lunch Special
items.text: The office cafeteria has a special menu on Thursdays. It costs $12.50. Lunch starts at 12:30 PM and ends at 2:00 PM.

questions.question: What day is the special menu?

items.title: Holiday Notice
items.text: The office is closed for 2 days. From December 25th to December 26th. We open again on December 27th at 9:00 AM.

questions.question: How many days is the office closed?
When does the office open again?
questions.explanation: The text says 'open again on December 27th'.

items.title: New Office
items.text: Our new office is on the 4th floor. It has 12 rooms. We have 3 meetings today. The first one is at 10:00 AM.

questions.question: Which floor is the office on?
How many meetings are there today?
questions.explanation: The text says 'We have 3 meetings today'.

items.title: Parking Fee
items.text: Parking costs $4 per hour. If you park for 3 hours, the price is $12. Payment is only by card.

questions.question: How much is one hour of parking?
Can you pay with cash?
questions.explanation: The text says 'Payment is only by card'.

items.title: File Archive Protocols
items.text: We have archives from 2010 to 2020. There are 500 folders in the **archive**. We need to move them on Saturday, June 8th. The **transfer** will take 4 hours.

vocabulary.definition: A place where historical documents or records are kept.
The act of moving something from one place to another.

items.title: Commuting to the Office
items.text: The bus to the office is number 88. It arrives every 15 minutes. The first bus is at 6:30 AM. The **frequency** of the bus is high during the **commute** hours.

vocabulary.definition: The rate at which something occurs or is repeated over a particular period of time.
Travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.

items.title: Printer Supply Management
items.text: One pack of paper has 500 sheets. We have 4 packs left in the **inventory**. That is 2,000 sheets in total. We must **restock** every month.

vocabulary.definition: A complete list of items such as property, goods in stock, or the contents of a building.
Replenish (a store) with fresh stock or supplies.

questions.question: How many sheets are in one pack?
What is the total number of sheets?
questions.explanation: The text says '2,000 sheets in total'.

items.title: Phone Number Confirmation
items.transcript: The office number is zero, two, zero, seven, nine, four, six, zero, one, two, three.

questions.question: Listen to the phone number and choose the correct option:

items.title: Appointment Time
items.transcript: Your meeting with the manager is scheduled for half past three tomorrow afternoon.

questions.question: Listen to the appointment time and choose the correct option:

items.title: Office Supply Price
items.transcript: The total for the office supplies today is one hundred and fifty-five dollars.

questions.question: Listen to the price and choose the correct option:
questions.explanation: The transcript says one hundred and fifty-five dollars ($155).
